songs.title: Bohemian Rhapsody - Remastered 2011
songs.fun_fact: The tape was run over recording heads so many times during the 180 vocal overdubs that it became transparent

songs.title: Africa
songs.fun_fact: David Paich wrote the chorus melody and lyrics in just 10 minutes on his new CS-80 keyboard

songs.title: Angels
songs.fun_fact: Robbie wrote it after leaving Take That, and it became his signature song and biggest hit

songs.title: Back In Black
songs.fun_fact: Recorded in the Bahamas while tropical storms kept hitting, causing electricity problems in the studio

songs.title: Thriller
songs.fun_fact: The album was recorded with a $750,000 budget, massive for 1982, and became the best-selling album ever

songs.title: Hallelujah
songs.fun_fact: Cohen wrote over 80 verses for this song, choosing only the best ones for the final version

songs.title: Father And Son
songs.fun_fact: Cat Stevens wrote this for a musical about the Russian Revolution, representing generations in conflict

songs.title: Hey Jude - Remastered 2015
songs.fun_fact: Paul wrote it to comfort John's son Julian during his parents' divorce, originally titled 'Hey Jules'

songs.title: Summer Of '69
songs.fun_fact: Despite popular belief, Bryan Adams was only 9 years old in the summer of '69, not a teenager

songs.title: Let It Be - Remastered 2009
songs.fun_fact: Paul dreamed of his deceased mother Mary appearing to him saying 'let it be', inspiring the song

songs.title: Highway to Hell
songs.fun_fact: Written about life on the road touring, not about Satan - the 'highway' was the Canning Highway in Australia

songs.title: Hotel California - 2013 Remaster
songs.fun_fact: The famous guitar solo at the end took two guitarists playing simultaneously to create the harmony

songs.title: Another One Bites The Dust - Remastered 2011
songs.fun_fact: Michael Jackson convinced Queen to release this as a single, and it became their best-selling hit in the US

songs.title: Beat It
songs.fun_fact: Eddie Van Halen recorded the iconic guitar solo for free as a favor, thinking it was a prank call at first

songs.title: Immigrant Song - Remaster
songs.fun_fact: Robert Plant wrote the lyrics after the band's tour of Iceland, inspired by Viking culture and Norse mythology

songs.title: Rocket Man (I Think It's Going To Be A Long, Long Time)
songs.fun_fact: Bernie Taupin was inspired by a Ray Bradbury short story when writing the lyrics about space isolation

songs.title: Eye of the Tiger
songs.fun_fact: Sylvester Stallone commissioned this song specifically for Rocky III after Queen denied him 'Another One Bites the Dust'

songs.title: Thunderstruck
songs.fun_fact: Angus Young came up with the main riff on a plane, tapping it out with his fingers during turbulence

songs.title: Smoke On The Water - Remastered 2012
songs.fun_fact: Written about a real fire at a casino in Montreux where Frank Zappa was performing, watched from Lake Geneva

songs.title: Stayin' Alive - From "Saturday Night Fever" Soundtrack
songs.fun_fact: Medical professionals use this song's 103 BPM rhythm to teach proper CPR chest compression timing

songs.title: We Are The Champions - Remastered 2011
songs.fun_fact: Freddie Mercury wrote it as a crowd participation song, and it's now played at nearly every sports event worldwide

songs.title: Take on Me
songs.fun_fact: The iconic music video took 16 weeks to create using rotoscoping, combining 3,000 sketched frames

songs.title: T.N.T.
songs.fun_fact: The song was recorded in just one take during their first album session, capturing their raw energy perfectly

songs.title: Yesterday - Remastered 2009
songs.fun_fact: Paul McCartney woke up with the melody in his head and initially called it 'Scrambled Eggs' as placeholder lyrics

songs.title: Sweet Dreams (Are Made of This) - 2005 Remaster
songs.fun_fact: Recorded in a cramped 8-track home studio above a shop, using a tiny budget and innovative synthesizer techniques

songs.title: It's My Life
songs.fun_fact: The music video features a then-unknown Shiri Appleby and helped revitalize Bon Jovi's career in the new millennium

songs.title: Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go
songs.fun_fact: Inspired by a note Andrew Ridgeley left for his parents that accidentally said 'go-go' instead of just 'go'

songs.title: We Will Rock You - Remastered 2011
songs.fun_fact: Brian May created the iconic stomp-stomp-clap rhythm to get audience participation at live shows

songs.title: Wind Of Change
songs.fun_fact: Written about the fall of the Berlin Wall, it became an anthem for the end of the Cold War in Europe

songs.title: Wonderwall
songs.fun_fact: Noel Gallagher said the song is about an imaginary friend who saves you from yourself when you're struggling

songs.title: Can't Help Falling in Love
songs.fun_fact: Based on an 18th-century French love song 'Plaisir d'amour', Elvis closed almost every concert with this song

songs.title: Forever Young
songs.fun_fact: Written during the Cold War when nuclear war seemed imminent, reflecting fears about humanity's future

songs.title: Sweet Caroline
songs.fun_fact: Originally about Caroline Kennedy, Neil Diamond later admitted it was actually about his wife at the time

songs.title: Stand By Me
songs.fun_fact: Ben E. King wrote this based on a gospel hymn, and it became one of the most-played songs of the 20th century

songs.title: What A Wonderful World
songs.fun_fact: Louis recorded this at age 66 in one take, and it was written to counter the negativity of the Vietnam War era

songs.title: I Want You Back
songs.fun_fact: Michael was only 11 years old when this was recorded, making him the youngest artist to top the US charts

songs.title: Take Me Home, Country Roads - Rerecorded
songs.fun_fact: Written about West Virginia despite Denver never visiting the state before writing it, inspired by Clopper Road

songs.title: We Are The World
songs.fun_fact: 45 of the biggest artists of the 80s recorded this in one night to raise money for African famine relief

songs.title: Mamma Mia
songs.fun_fact: The title came from the band's manager exclaiming 'Mamma mia!' when he first heard the infectious melody

songs.title: Sunny
songs.fun_fact: This Bobby Hebb cover became Boney M.'s breakthrough hit and topped charts across Europe in the disco era

songs.title: Lemon Tree
songs.fun_fact: This German band's only international hit, the catchy chorus made it a one-hit wonder heard worldwide

songs.title: Don't Worry Be Happy
songs.fun_fact: The first a cappella song to reach #1 on the Billboard Hot 100, recorded entirely with Bobby's voice

songs.title: Waterloo
songs.fun_fact: Won the Eurovision Song Contest for Sweden, launching ABBA to international superstardom overnight

songs.title: YMCA
songs.fun_fact: The iconic dance with hand gestures spelling Y-M-C-A was created by fans, not the band themselves

songs.title: September
songs.fun_fact: The date 'September 21st' was chosen simply because it sounded good rhythmically, not for any special reason

songs.title: Mambo No. 5 (a Little Bit of...)
songs.fun_fact: Based on a 1949 instrumental by Pérez Prado, Lou Bega's version added lyrics naming women alphabetically

songs.title: Sweet Home Alabama
songs.fun_fact: Written as a response to Neil Young's critical songs about the South, but the two were actually friends

songs.title: Daddy Cool
songs.fun_fact: Producer Frank Farian actually sang most vocals himself, with the band mainly performing for videos and tours

songs.title: The Final Countdown
songs.fun_fact: The keyboard riff was written on a cheap Yamaha keyboard Joey Tempest got as a kid, using factory presets

songs.title: I Love Rock 'N Roll
songs.fun_fact: Originally by the Arrows, Joan saw them perform it on UK TV in 1975 and spent years making her own version

songs.title: Jump - 2015 Remaster
songs.fun_fact: Eddie Van Halen wanted to use keyboards but was hesitant as fans expected only guitar; it became their biggest hit

songs.title: It's Raining Men - Single Version
songs.fun_fact: Originally offered to Cher and Diana Ross who both rejected it before the Weather Girls made it a disco anthem

songs.title: Should I Stay or Should I Go - Remastered
songs.fun_fact: Became a hit 9 years after release when featured in a Levi's commercial, reaching #1 in the UK in 1991

songs.title: Super Trouper
songs.fun_fact: Named after the Super Trouper spotlight used in concerts, which felt like being in the sun to ABBA's Frida

songs.title: Walking On Sunshine
songs.fun_fact: Written in 10 minutes, this feel-good anthem has been used in over 100 commercials and countless films

songs.title: Somebody To Love - Remastered 2011
songs.fun_fact: Freddie Mercury wrote this inspired by Aretha Franklin's gospel style, with complex multi-layered harmonies

songs.title: Respect
songs.fun_fact: Originally by Otis Redding, Aretha's version added 'R-E-S-P-E-C-T' spelling and became a feminist anthem

songs.title: Rosanna
songs.fun_fact: The famous 'half-time shuffle' drum pattern became one of the most studied and imitated in rock history

songs.title: Dancing Queen
songs.fun_fact: The only ABBA song to hit #1 in the US, inspired by George McCrae's 'Rock Your Baby' rhythm

songs.title: Don't Stop Me Now - Remastered 2011
songs.fun_fact: Freddie wrote this at 3 AM in his Munich apartment, capturing his euphoric lifestyle at the time

songs.title: I Will Always Love You
songs.fun_fact: Originally by Dolly Parton, Whitney's version stayed at #1 for 14 weeks, one of the longest chart runs ever

songs.title: Surfin' U.S.A. - Remastered 2001
songs.fun_fact: Based on Chuck Berry's 'Sweet Little Sixteen' melody, Brian Wilson rewrote lyrics about California surf spots

songs.title: Smooth Criminal - 2012 Remaster
songs.fun_fact: Michael's famous 45-degree lean required a specially patented shoe design to achieve without wires

songs.title: I'm So Excited
songs.fun_fact: Originally released in 1982, it became a massive hit when re-released in 1984 with a new remix

songs.title: I Wanna Dance with Somebody (Who Loves Me)
songs.fun_fact: Written in under 2 hours by the same team that created 'How Will I Know', earning them a Grammy

songs.title: Uptown Girl
songs.fun_fact: Billy wrote this as a tribute to Frankie Valli and the Four Seasons' doo-wop style from the 1960s

songs.title: Music
songs.fun_fact: The dramatic orchestral arrangement made this prog-rock anthem a surprise hit, reaching #3 in the UK

songs.title: Don't Stop Believin'
songs.fun_fact: Became the best-selling digital track from the 20th century after its use in The Sopranos finale

songs.title: Zombie
songs.fun_fact: Written in protest of IRA violence after two children were killed in a bombing in Warrington, England

songs.title: I Will Survive - Single Version
songs.fun_fact: Originally a B-side, DJs started playing it over the A-side, making it the ultimate empowerment anthem

songs.title: Baker Street
songs.fun_fact: The iconic saxophone solo was played by Raphael Ravenscroft, who was paid just £27 for the session

songs.title: Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (A Man After Midnight)
songs.fun_fact: Madonna sampled the main riff for her 2005 hit 'Hung Up' after personally asking ABBA for permission

songs.title: Billie Jean
songs.fun_fact: Michael recorded the vocals through a 5-foot cardboard tube to get that distinctive compressed sound

songs.title: Maniac
songs.fun_fact: Originally written about a serial killer, the lyrics were changed for Flashdance to be about dancing

songs.title: Hold the Line
songs.fun_fact: Toto's debut single that showcased their virtuoso musicianship, all members were top session players

songs.title: Celebration - Single Version
songs.fun_fact: Written as an Islamic song about a holy celebration, it became the ultimate party anthem instead

songs.title: Basket Case
songs.fun_fact: Billie Joe wrote this about his anxiety attacks and fear of going crazy, becoming their breakthrough hit

songs.title: Everybody (Backstreet's Back) - Radio Edit
songs.fun_fact: The Halloween-themed music video featured the boys as different monsters and became an MTV staple

songs.title: Narcotic - Radio Edit
songs.fun_fact: This German band's whistled hook became instantly recognizable, making it a worldwide one-hit wonder

songs.title: Bitter Sweet Symphony - Remastered 2016
songs.fun_fact: Used a Rolling Stones sample without full permission, losing all royalties until rights returned in 2019

songs.title: Jerk It Out
songs.fun_fact: Featured in an iPod shuffle commercial, introducing this Swedish garage rock band to global audiences

songs.title: Let Me Entertain You
songs.fun_fact: Written as Robbie's rebellious statement after leaving Take That, showcasing his new rock-oriented sound

songs.title: The Show Must Go On - Remastered 2011
songs.fun_fact: Freddie recorded vocals while gravely ill, Brian May doubted he could sing it but Freddie proved him wrong

songs.title: Let's Twist Again
songs.fun_fact: Won a Grammy for Best Rock Performance, capitalizing on the massive twist dance craze Checker started

songs.title: Under Pressure - Remastered 2011
songs.fun_fact: Created spontaneously during a Queen/Bowie jam session, the famous bassline was nearly forgotten and had to be recreated

songs.title: Twist And Shout - Remastered 2009
songs.fun_fact: Recorded in one take at the end of a grueling 12-hour session, John's voice was shredded afterwards

songs.title: The Sound of Silence - Acoustic Version
songs.fun_fact: Originally flopped, then producer Tom Wilson added electric instruments without the duo knowing, making it a hit

songs.title: We Didn't Start the Fire
songs.fun_fact: Lists 118 historical events from 1949-1989 in rapid-fire lyrics, inspired by a conversation with a 21-year-old

songs.title: Crocodile Rock
songs.fun_fact: Elton's homage to early rock and roll, deliberately written in a simple 1950s style with nonsense lyrics

songs.title: You Give Love A Bad Name
songs.fun_fact: Desmond Child co-wrote this mega-hit in just two hours, it became Bon Jovi's first #1 single

songs.title: Smells Like Teen Spirit
songs.fun_fact: Kurt Cobain was trying to write the ultimate pop song, accidentally creating the grunge anthem instead

songs.title: Girls Just Want to Have Fun
songs.fun_fact: Originally written by Robert Hazard from a male perspective, Cyndi transformed it into a feminist anthem

songs.title: What Is Love - 7" Mix
songs.fun_fact: The Saturday Night Live 'Roxbury guys' head-bobbing sketch made this song a cultural phenomenon again

songs.title: Paradise City
songs.fun_fact: Written on the back of a tour bus, contrasting the harsh life on the road with dreams of home

songs.title: Flashdance...What a Feeling - Radio Edit
songs.fun_fact: Won the Oscar for Best Original Song and stayed at #1 for six weeks, defining the 80s movie soundtrack era

songs.title: Can't Stop
songs.fun_fact: John Frusciante's intricate guitar work was inspired by Jimi Hendrix's avant-garde approach to funk

songs.title: I Want It That Way
songs.fun_fact: The lyrics deliberately make no logical sense, but Max Martin's melody made it their signature song anyway

songs.title: Livin' On A Prayer
songs.fun_fact: The iconic talkbox intro was played by Richie Sambora using a Heil Talk Box pedal

songs.title: Sweet Child O' Mine
songs.fun_fact: Slash created the iconic opening riff as a finger exercise, never expecting it to become a song

songs.title: In the End
songs.fun_fact: Chester Bennington recorded 50+ vocal takes because the band wanted perfection for this emotional centerpiece
